title: Isolate the Quadratic Term and Make Its Coefficient One
text: We add $$48$$ to both sides to get $$x^2$$ by itself which gives $$x^2=48$$. Since the coefficient of $$x^2$$ is $$1$$ already, we do not need to take extra step.

title: Use Square root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$. $$x^2=48$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$x=\sqrt{48}$$ or $$x=-\sqrt{48}$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$x^2-48$$ $$=$$ $$0$$ has two solutions which are $$x=4\sqrt{3}$$ and $$x=-4\sqrt{3}$$.
